metadata.title: CVE-2022-3910 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
Use After Free vulnerability in Linux Kernel allows Privilege Escalation.An improper Update of Reference Count in io_uring leads to Use-After-Freeand Local Privilege Escalation. When io_msg_ring was invoked with a fixedfile, it called io_fput_file() which improperly decreased its referencecount (leading to Use-After-Free and Local Privilege Escalation). Fixedfiles are permanently registered to the ring, and should not be putseparately. We recommend upgrading past commithttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.1.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required
